The oysters were delicious, the fish unbelievable. The unfiltered sake pairing was perfect. Don was the perfect host and Dana also made us feel at home. Perfect opportunity to eat great seafood and meet new friends.

FOOD

title: The Bimini Twist, San Francisco

review_list:
I was able to score reservation to see Chef Geoffrey do his magic. My family and I enjoy every bite of our food. Each dish was unique and bursting with flavors. We would definitely visit again.

i love the ambiance
also the food
my cousin accompany here to taste the food that they are offering the food was so delicious and it worth the price i would certainly visit this again and again and again

I dined at Ichido when it was located in the Dogpatch part of san francisco. There were approximately 20 people present. We sat at communal tables. Before each dish, Chef Geoff would tell us where he harvested the fish from and how he prepared it. The food was excellent and the wine/beverage pairings were not only spot on but generous...


More  



Geoff tailored a great meal for a surprise party for my wife. He was able to nail innovative dishes around food items that my wife loves, personalizing the menu, and finding a venue that had great ambiance. He even created on-the-spot vegan versions of his fish and meat dishes.

The entire dining experience was fantastic - from receiving the details of the secretive location, to sitting at a cozy table with an enthusiastic group of people for a delicious three hour dinner. Geoff is phenomenally talented, and makes you feel like you are a guest at his home.

The fish is caught fresh daily and depending on the catch will determine what is on the menu: an amazing gastronomic experience and such a creative chef. A must do.

Geoff showed off his incredible talent for our dinner party. The food was a delight for your senses. He should charge more.

Amazing!! Geoff caught the seafood fresh that morning and came up with an intensely creative menu. It was a unique experience to see him prepare a stingray just before grilling it. The flavors were superb. I loved the whole meal.

Coming from Canada, I was not sure where to go in San Francisco for food. Ichido came up as one of the top places in SF so I decided to give it a try.
It was my first experience in a pop-up style restaurant. There was no front of the house, no sous chef, nothing. Geoff ran this one-man show...


More  



Was invited to a friend's house for dinner. Little did I know what was planned. Geoff served up a great meal. Each course was incredible. He made it all in front of us and then provided a great description of how the food was caught. A very cool evening.
title: Ichido, San Francisco
address: Kearny Street, Near Pine St, San Francisco, CA 94107

review_list:
Great place to pick up a sandwich, italian meats and food and a good selection of italian wines. Lovely North Beach location, close to cafes, bakeries and restaurants and walking distance to Chinatown.

From the salami selection, to their cheeses to their prosciutto - everything is delicious! I also quite enjoy their pre-made frozen dinners to take home. The lasagna is fantastic!

lack of atmosphere, counter service,takeout. vast selection of every variety of Italian foods,wines,breads,confections etc.

Whenever we go to North Beach, we always stop by Molinari's. The meats and cheeses (and Italian cooking essentials) are fantastic

Molinari is a San Francisco favorite. It's fun to to explore all the different products throughout the store. There is always a bit of a line, but it's usually worth the wait. Some of the meats are a little too salty, but always pleased with whatever I get.

When you envision a deli, Molinari is what you see. The sights, the smells, the people this is what a deli should be. And not all great delis are in New York City. Their salami is the best, the best. Get a salami and provelone sandwich for a quick trip to heaven. Anything you get here is great. A must...


More  



Tried the "Italian Combo" sandwich which was very filling and delicious. Would recommend this place to every visitor but beware of the line.

Great food with good price. 2 combos for 28 bucks. The sandwiches were amazing and fresh. They definitely filled us up! Great stop for sure!!

The staff was very friendly and the food was excellent. I ordered the veg sandwich which was just cheese and fixings. It was great! My husband got a classic sandwich with several types of meat and LOVED it.

Busy and small, the Molinari salami is famous and well deserved. Dry salami at its best served with Italian breads and dressings. During peak times the lines stretch out the small shop but the wait is worth it. I'd come back if in the area, but the good places in Sunnyvale (zanottos) also carry Molinari salami and you don't need...

review_list:
I was pleasantly surprised when I visited Gary Danko on a late Friday afternoon. The food was well put together and presented, the waiters and service staff were fast and friendly, and the overall price and experience made for a restaurant experience well worth the effort of getting there.

Superb service, gorgeous setting, and incredible fun food. I have always taken out-of-visitors here... and it ends up being the best restaurant experience they have ever had.....not inexpensive but well worth the charge.

We got to Gary Danko to celebrate a family occasion; all families members chose this restaurant and mainly for the food, of course. The atmosphere is good, and the staff usually are very attentive. We've never been disappointed.

The food, ambiance, and service were all fantastic! Came in for a solo dinner on a week day, even though I couldn't get a reservation. I was welcomed into the bar where they serve the full dinner menu, and was blown away by the wonderful service and delicious food! Get the tasting menu, it's worth every penny!

I recently took my wife, sister and brother-in-law to Gary Danko, after not having been there in several years. My sister, who makes a point of visiting famous restaurants all over the world, said it was the best meal she ever had. It is an amazing experience. If you have not yet been there, go as soon as possible!

We have dined many times at GD and the service and ambiance of the restaurant is exceptional. Steve the maitre'd is a very friendly and efficient. The menu changes periodically but is NEVER without many many exquisitely prepared and served.
This is the BEST restaurant in San Francisco.

This is not only a wonderful restaurant with nice ambiance, but the staff is very helpful and attentive without being "in your face"

Gary Danko is a San Francisco institution. We went for a special occasion and came back feeling very special indeed! Service is impeccable and the food was great.
Only downside is that you are nearly rubbing elbows with your fellow patron, however, that is a common San Francisco issue.

Great experience and not a steak and mash potato house! And 100 hundred more characters long, and longer and longer.

To get a table took some work but when we did they followed up well, a good sign with regards to attention to details
Waiters and sommelier are knowledgable and friendly
Food stacks up for this type of pricing
The venison was great and the salmon was even better after which the fillet was better still and the butter cake...

review_list:
Kokkari was highly recommended to us by local friends who reside in San Francisco. It is very hard to find a truly good Greek restaurant in the USA. Upon entering Kokkari and spotting the open hearth with a lamb on the spit got us in the right mood for an excellent meal. The fried Greek cheese was excellent as well...


More  



Warm, inviting restaurant. Was invited to a family gathering. Restaurant went out of their way to make it a special evening for the group. And, the food is terrific.

A San Francisco institution with consistent excellent food, drinks, and service. Big enough of a place to accommodate large crowd if you can plan ahead. I have eaten here for lunch and dinner. Yummy every time I am there.

I visited recently with two foodies. The place is very popular and booking is essential.
We were very impressed with the relaxed atmosphere of the place, the tasteful decor and sudued lighting. The service was friendly (though our waiter was a little forward in repeatedly addressing us as 'my friends'.)
The food was good, though none of us thought it...


More  



Very pleasant atmosphere. We walked in and saw a lamb on a spit in a large fireplace, so you know the souvla is fresh. The fish was delicious, the service impeccable. The menu can get pricey but moderate items were available.

I have dined at Kokkari numerous times over many years and this is one of my favorites in SF. I can't remember a dining experience that has failed to meet my expectations.

great old world atmosphere, delicious food, professional friendly service.
I recommend the table next to the large fire place!

One of my favorite places in the city. Love the cozy fireplace which matches the warmth of the servers and staff. Get a reservation a month out for a weekend. Yum. Can't miss.

Fried smelts were very tasty, small Greek salad was well prepared tomatoes ripened to perfection. Lamb skewers medium rare were a perfect addition. Ate at the bar. Well done!

The energy and warmth of this restaurant draw you in. It just has a special feel. The food is fresh and full of Greek flavor. We loved every bite from the appetizers to desserts. It's a popular place, reservations recommended.

review_list:
Good service, good breakfast and menu variety. Not the cheapest though so you'll need to slip a fifty into the back pocket.

Super American breakfast with lots of things on the menu. Personally I had pancakes with millionaire bacon and poached eggs: huge portions and very good! My colleagues had different things but all plates look amazing and you are filled up for the entire day.
There is a queue to do as the place is popular but it's worth it!

My husband and I ate here one Friday morning. We were seated quickly. The menu had a good variety. The food was good, but in my opinion not worth the $40+ including tip. Only one of us had a beverage. I had pancakes, poached eggs and chicken mango sausage. Meh. My husband had poached eggs, which had nice orange yolks,...


More  



A great find on my San Fran trip. Large yummy portions of deliciousness! Come Hungary and leave full only to return the next day!! The millionaire bacon is off the charts - sweet snd spicy. A symphony in my mouth. A must for anyone is the Bay Area looking for a great breakfast or lunch!

There might be a wait. If the wait is too long (it's good but not great), check out restaurants on Fillmore St.

Have been here 2-3 times and always excellent for breakfast. Fast friendly service. Very high quality food with thick slice of whole wheat bread for the toast, the amazing millionaire bacon slow roasted for hours in spices and maple syrup and eggs cooked exactly as ordered. Only go on off hours or weekdays if you don't want to wait hours...

We were in San Francisco for 4 days and had breakfast here twice. The Latte and hot chocolate were delicious and generously sized. Had the Millionaire's bacon and it was ok, could've been crisper. My family loved the crepes; they ordered them both times we ate there.
Service was excellent. Be ready to wait on weekends.

Stopping by for a more US style breakfast me and my partner found Sweet Maple very friendly with good food and good service. The portion size was massive for us and we struggled through it, but it was a good hearty breakfast.

What can one say about Sweet Maple's food and service (for breakfast) except WOW! What can one say about Sweet Maple's Millionaire's Bacon except AMAAAZING! In many of my reviews I describe a restaurant as having OK food but No "WOW" factor. Well ladies and gentleman, here it is at Sweet Maple in San Francisco...The all mighty and powerful "wow"...

You'll hear this place is the home of Millionaire's bacon, and for that reason you need to shape your breakfast or brunch around it! Not much to say that hasn't been said. Seven Hills is such a personal, romantic place to eat dinner. Fantastic, inventive cuisine, served by staff with personality and personal interest. It's a must go for us on every trip now.

Alexis runs a great small restaurant ! Lovely Italian food, good ambiance, and good service. Such a shame we are 5,400 miles away or we would be regular customers for sure!

Cozy, warm, fun place. The food is excellent, service is ok, and the wine list is also ok. There were six of us and this place is reasonable and fun, the food is really good.

A chef with no compromises. Everything exquisite and tasty with uncanny flavors that you want to let sit in your mouth. BUT it is noisy and seating cramped so select your table accordingly.

Small restaurant with a select menu. We ordered the pasta and it was really incredible. Kale infused. Octopus starter was so fresh. Portions are nice sized but not family style. Will go back this trip

The tastiest pizza and entrees in the city, located around 348 Columbus!!!
The surrounding pizzerias overcharge for tourists and quite frankly there food is mediocre!!!
Here you will enjoy a cool friendly hip dining experience, ultra friendly staff and stone baked pizzas cooked right in the dining area.
Simply mouthwatering. . I want one now!!!!!!

After reviewing options on TripAdvisor, we chose to eat lunch here. No disappointment here! We ordered the prosciutto pizza and pasta carbonara. Yum!!! Service was friendly and fast and food was fresh and tasty. A must try if you're in the area!

We had good pizza in this place, made in a wood oven. The House wine, from Sonoma, is really good. Starters, desserts, and coffee are great. Service is ok. The place's decor is modern and clean.

My husband and I went for dinner one night. We had the Italian buffalo mozzarella for an appetizer. It was amazing, hands down the best buffalo mozzarella I've had. Highly recommend coming here if you want fresh authentic Italian food. My husband and I shared a pasta and pizza and both tasted amazing. You can tell that the pasta is home-made which made it even better. Loved it!

They have the real deal pizza wood oven and have the authentication certified from Napoli. Pizza is great. Really enjoyed calzone as well. Salad was boring. Service was great and waiters were helpful and friendly all round. Not much ambience here but for a pizza place on Columbus this is a good choice.

Very crowded with what looked like 1-2 servers. Very negligent of the patrons. Water was out, food was brought so late it was cold and soggy! They should have offered us a new pizza. It was completely unacceptable and disappointing!

Don't waste your time. This is it. The best Pizza in town. You might possibly find the Ninja turtles in the kitchen 😉

We were looking for good pizza, so we headed down here after a bit of online research. What a find, great place with a casual bustling feel, food was delicious with a well priced wine list.

We fell in love with this place at first glance. It's always our lunch spot when we go to the city. This is probably our fifth time here and it's due for a review. However, nothing that I write hasn't already been written. Always a must when in the city. They always have a great selection of oysters. Staff are knowledgeable are eager too help you decide the perfect oyster to suit your taste. A bit expensive but it's a treat.

Good experience, good view, good food, quite of noise not the best service ever, I love places that treat you special

Have been here previously, and I am a huge fan of good oysters. Hog Island never fails to exceed all expectations! The oysters are just so fresh and well shucked. The Hog Wash (their versions of a mignonette type sauce) is perfect for the briney pacific oysters. Can't beat the location, right on the Bay.

We stopped here after a ferry ride to Sauce lit. The place was very busy, found a great spot at the bar. I had grilled oysters and freshly baked bread, the wine was delicious. It was a bit pricey but a place to have fresh oysters

We had to try Hog Island once we saw shrimp & grits on the menu - delicious. It's obvious that this is the place to go if you want Oysters. My husband had a small order and said they were good. We didn't have to wait too long to be seated. Expect a wait when the weather is nice!

We had a late lunch here so it was not too crowded and we did not have to wait for a spot at the bar.
We shard 2 dozen oysters and two salads and had a couple of glasses of chablis. Absolutely delicious! Great to get the oyster selection and try different types. These were possibly the freshest oysters that...

We stumbled across Hog Island early on NY eve. Initially put off by long queue we decided to wait. It was worth it.
The seafood is amazingly fresh, we sat close to the kitchen area and watched the attention to detail of senior staff checking every dish before it left the kitchen.
The oysters are sublime, we had a mixed...

Have the clam chowder!!!! I can't say enough positive about it. It was flavourful, FULL of clams and beautifully spiced. Our server was attentive but not overbearing. Be prepared to wait though because it's so popular that it seems there's always a line up. The oysters are fresh and SO tasty. They're obviously proud to serve good food.

All the food was prepared fresh and great flavor. Menu was very limited but the food was excellent. I had combo fish and chips plate with coconut shrimp. Several fresh made sauces and loved the spicy tarter sauce.

I had dinner at Pacific Catch with two others. We got a table right away and our server was so, so nice and attentive. And the food...some of the best fish dishes I have had in a long time! You could go to a $$$$ restaurant and get the same quality at triple the price.

Excellent food,great staff and great value.the food was really delicious.the staff were very cheerful and helpful.i visited with family and friends while on holidays and had lovely night here.

This is a great place to go for a wide variety of options. The salads are very good/a nice break if you've been eating heavier fare. The service has been just about perfect every time we've been there.

Hole in the wall that serves up Poke bowls, Korean barbecue and great fish and chips. Limited seating. In a very walkable neighborhood. We went twice in one trip, it was so good

This breakfast restaurant is out of this world for the value. Everything is over the top and plenty of it The fruit they give you is enough for 3 people

I came in SF twice and both times I went here for a great breakfast. You don't wanna miss this place if you are in San Fran. Big portion, amazing taste and wide selection!
There's something to suit everybody's fancy. You'll like it.

We decided to visit this restaurant after seeing the reviews at trip advisor. I must say it's definitely worth a visit. I had the crab omlet with a bowl of fruit. The omlet is fresh and tastes great. I can recommend it. Also the fruit as a side dish is refreshing!

The Hollywood Café opens at 7:00.

Came here for lunch with friends. The food was made to perfection and taste was awesome. The service was warm and to sum it up a near perfect experience.

The restaurant is designed in a French colonial style. It has a lovely atmosphere of a larger restaurant. The food is fusion and absolutely delicious. Price is reasonable with about $28 for a main course.

This French-Vietnamese restaurant offers a great place to take business colleagues or a romantic date. The food and experience is unforgettable. We had the lamp chops, sea food, salads and they were all fantastic. We loved it and will come back!

We certainly enjoyed the food and the service but when the bill arrived we were in for a shock. This place certainly recreates an old french colonial bistro but it comes at a price. The menu is interesting, variety OK but just beware of the exaggerated prices.

I had a very delicious meat dish which was served with a salad bed. Athmosphere was very good at Le Colonial! Service was also very good so I really can recommend this place to everyone

Get there early. If possible avoid meal times. Before or after that. (Especially if you have the flexibility of a tourist! This place is popular with locals too.)
Try the seafood cocktail, sashimi plates, fresh oysters and smoked salmon. Yum!
Note that it is cash only.

Dinner for two with handcrafted cocktails in the adjacent bar. Traditional elegant décor and furnishings with very attentive service. Venison was perfectly coked and presented. Even the baked Alaska was delightful-when was the last time you had that? The ambience, food, service and presentation makes this a repeat classic.

I had a reservation for 2 at 10pm tonight and learned that my flight from Seattle to San Francisco was over two hours delayed meaning I would not make my 10 pm reservation. I called the restaurant at 5:45 from Seattle airport to let them know and they said they would still charge my credit card for 100 per person....


More  



Parsnip soup richness. Scallop sweet amid ink dark noodles. Risotto re-delivered to get right. Czech beer pairs well these courses. Smiles all around.

I was taken there by friends from San Francisco and thoroughly enjoyed the meal. It was great food, good service & nice setting. My friends had been there many times over the years and they said the food is consistently good.
Out waiter made a mistake delivered and opened a wrong bottle of wine which was rectified promptly.

We truly enjoyed a fantastic dinner with impeccable, friendly service. The ambience reminded me of a Chicago (or New York) intimate supper club. The tasting menu was spectacular -- I added on the seared fois gras - completely worth the added cost. We started with champagne and were invited to add fresh truffles. The lobster was sublime, the rib eye...


More  



Chef Roland Passot has a long time classic winner at La Folie. All the dishes are wonderful. Very flavorful and tasty entrees now are the Pan Seared Black Cod and Lobster and Mushroom Risotto. The Wine pairings are excellent. Save room for the exquisite desserts.

La Folie is the standard by which other fine restaurants should be compared. We absolutely enjoyed this dining experience....and....it truly was a dining experience. The decor of the restaurant is very tasteful and inviting. La Folie exemplifies what fine dining means.
Upon entering La Folie we were respectfully greeted and escorted to our table. Our server immediately came to our...


More  



This restaurant is close to our condo. We have eaten here before and been disappointed, as the prices are quite high, due to its Michelin star. We were here for drinks and bar food this time. The sliders were excellent. I passed on the foie gras, as it was $50!!!!

My wife and I have had the pleasure of many Michelin star restaurants and although this was nice, I don't feel it deserved a star. Not once did they get our order right, they kept bringing the wrong dish and the food took a long time to arrive. Service was good but not Michelin star. We paid $800 for 3...


More  



The place, the service and the food were just great. We had a private meeting of about 50 people and none of us were disappointed. Everything that we were served from the appetizers to the desert was excellent.

review_list:
This is national literary landmark that has graced San Francisco since 1908. This is where Sam Spade dined in Dashiell Hammett’s novel “The Maltese Falcon”. The same meal he had in the novel is on the menu– Sam Spade’s Lamb Chops. Served with baked potato and sliced tomatoes.
John’s Grill is located in Downtown San Francisco at 63 Ellis Street....


More  



Old world charm, Dashiell Hammett Society location, delicious food and good service. The Jerusalem Chicken was fabulous and large proportions; NY strip tender and generously sized. If in Union Square area of SF, would highly recommend.

This was a lovely restaurant steeped in history as many celebrities had visited this restaurant. There was a girl outside giving you the option of looking at the menu first with no pressure to go in. Staff inside were very pleasant too and the steak was beautiful. We were glad we had visited there and thanks Johns Grill for a...


More  



We decided to try John's Grill due to the reference in The Maltese Falcon. Ordered the lamb chops medium rare and they were outstanding. My boyfriend had a great steak and the homemade vanilla bean ice cream is unexpectedly good.

John's Grill is a historic restaurant within walking distance from Union Square.
Great overall ambience, live music and a delicious affordable menu make of this a great choice for dinner or lunch.

We dropped in on a spur of the moment and what a great discovery. Good reasonably priced menu with loads of character in the heart of San Francisco. We'll definitely be back.

Have been here twice. Good service, nice choice of California wines and a classical menu. The broiled salmon and porterhouse steak were great with a bottle of Zinfandel. Nice live music.
An historic place in town

A great place to eat a steak without going crazy in price, really free perfectly cooked meat and side dishes, beverages are also very reasonably priced, its not your 5 star steak house but a great place to be, live music in the 2nd floor restaurant level, table sizes and spacing is good and the noise level downstairs is very...

Dropped in without a reservation right at dinner time and were seated immediately upstairs. At first glance, you would think you were in an old New York City steakhouse -- tables two stories up, white linen table clothes, celebrities on the wall and a menu that screamed 1940s.
Nothing fancy or special here. We ordered salads and I was disappointed...


More  



Johns grill has great steak and seafood! It can be busy and a bit tight,but well worth it! Best to make reservations. I love the ribeye, as well as the shrimp cocktail...enjoy! PS Great friendly staff!

Dined there with a bunch of friends and, seriously has been the last time there.
We waited a lot to make the order and we asked for some pomegranate margarita.
Well, i had to ask if it was alcolic or not 'cause it tasted like colored water.
Plate we took (bowl uno) was...I don't know...unusual?
No...never again.

Very nice food pricy but they serve farm fresh organic food, hence its worth.
Their house made tortilla and guacamole were delicious. Tamale and quesadilla were tasty. And peach cobbler were amazingly tasty. Great ambiance, good service, open kitchen. However located in the San Francisco downtown so parking is not free.
But overall my experience was good I will definitely...


More  



Probably the best Mexican food I've ever had! We ordered ChimiChangas (special that night), Flautas, and Tacos. They were absolutely amazing! We also had a Pomegranate Margarita and another drink, the name of which I forget, (specials that night) which were excellent!
The restaurant was open late on a Sunday night which was fantastic and the staff were very friendly!...


More  



Amazing as always. Sister location in LA is equally delicious. Service is great & it's located in the heart of the mission, which is often overlooked by tourists. Highly recommended for vegan & meat eaters alike.

The food was absolutely delicious and the service was fast and friendly! Gracias Madre has a homey feeling too. I would highly recommend the chimichanga.

I've always liked this restaurant and usually visit every time I come to San Francisco. I wasn't as happy with my most recent visit. I ordered the tacos and the tortillas were tough from being cooked too long. The peach cobbler was great, though. It can get very crowded.

After my great experience of Cafe Gratitude in LA, i was keen to try their sister branch in San Francisco. The food is organic and vegan but the vibe in the cafe is very different. Food offerings are mexican inspired and tasty, but nothing special.

This restaurant offers creative, tasty, vegan dishes at reasonable prices. The service was excellent given that the restaurant was packed.

Everything was very good, the kind of place you return to again and again because you know what you'll get. A full vegetarian mexican menu, to me means I can close my eyes and point. Not like somewhere else where you order the veggie pot stickers and bite into meat!!!
title: Gracias Madre, San Francisco

It's like you have stepped back into time! I hope they never change it. Drinks, entertainment, and staff were all perfect!

Over-popular venue for Happy Hour when drinks and light buffet are reduced price but you have to wait for entry and then the venue seems overfull

Wish we could go in the pool like the old days! The drinks are great. The food is excellent. Relaxing and fun at the same time.

Loved it - not to be missed if in San Fran. Unexpected jungle room bar at the base of the Fairmont.
Enjoy an umbrellaed cocktail, great Asian Pacific cuisine and live music. The ambience will take you away - fun decor and very definitely a surprise in the more classic Fairmont above.

This bar is tacky but it's an essential stop for a trip to San Fran. Get a seat by the pool for an unforgettable experience.

Recommended by nearby hotel for breakfast. Had Eggs Benedict. Hollandaise was too runny and too much vinegar. Potatoes not particularly flavoursome and inconsistent in firmness. Price around $15. Service fine.
Would not go back again and when you pay only $20 more for main course of Bouillabaisse at Hog Oyster I would not say it was great value.

Cozy restaurant. We shared California omelette with fresh tomato avacado cheese and herbs. Cooked perfectly very fresh tasting. Nice crispy potatoes. Also shared French toast made from crossaints. Light and crispy and chewy. Really delicious.

Breakfasted here two days in a row while at a conference. Both times got poached eggs--excellent and easy to mess up so I was pleased. Good coffee. Friendly service. Good pasta options and decent service.
Can't go wrong eating here.

Great food...great times. We typically go here a couple times a year.
You won't be disappointed. Give it a try.

Had dinner with six people. Food was very good. The atmosphere is old school Italian but very good. Everything we had was very good hefty portions. Service was very good and reasonably priced (including the wine list)

Hands down best blueberry pancakes I've ever had. Goodness me I wish I could replicate the recipe. Great place to start the day!

We veered off the main street of San Francisco's Little Italy - one block to this awesome breakfast spot! Friendly service and great food! We would return anytime!

Get ready for a big meal - these burgers are delicious and cooked to perfection over fire. Great fries - good service. The buns are too big and are perhaps 50% of the burger.

only had a 15 minute wait before being shown to our table, cocktails were the best we've had in San Francisco.

Cheesecakes with almost any topping you can imagine. They had a seasonal Pumpkin number that was really tasty. Bit of a wait for a table, so we did take-out each time. During the week we had the snickers, adams peanut butter, chocolate mousse and carrot cake - all of them were awesome.

The restaurant has a great menu but what it makes the difference in this particular place, is the views of Union Square, specially at night.
title: The Cheesecake Factory, San Francisco

review_list:
We went here a couple of times for some lunch. Very relaxed setting, with nice food, great if you are super hungry.
Super large range of food, so something for everyone.

We had here some hamburgers from different variety, and everybody was completely satisfied. Delicious, American way of kitchen, and cold tap beers. My recommendation is going for them!

The food is on par with a Chili's or Applebees. The atmosphere is nice, and it is quite enough for groups to engage in conversation. The pie is not fresh.

nice to have a "diner" experience. food is good, quick and cheap! service is great specially if they know you are tourists.

We had breakfast at Lori's. The Marriott across the street recommended them (and pointed out a discount coupon on the tourist map). Great choice. I had a vegetarian omelet that included vegetarian chili and related condiments. It was perfect for a big breakfast. Coffee was very good. Recommend.

Lori's was fine - it was close to my hotel. There was nothing to complain about. Burger, fries, and soft drink with tip - $20. Service was friendly.

The decor of this place is great... Looks like a real 1950's diner. The food is pretty average though. I had chicken tenders and sweet potato fries which were good but very average. My girlfriend had the roast turkey but didn't really enjoy it that much.

Very nice diner food; they have it all, from burgers to salads to nice desserts. Service was quick and efficient.

I love places that serve breakfast all day….specially if their pancakes are as good as in this place and my husband can eat a great burger and fries while I´m over pancakes and hash brown! Perfect!

Had the grilled chicken teriyaki and it was very good, service was quick. Was a pleasant surprise. Was expecting more typical "diner" food, but was much better, lots of variety on the menu, huge portion.

We just happened onto Coqueta in a quest for a cocktail one Sunday afternoon. Blown away by the great service all around. We had good interaction with our server as he knew the menu and ingredients/techniques well. The food here is the star. Nice Spanish fare at Pier 5. Food covers the range from tapas, pintoxs and paella. Reasonably attentive service. Tables are closely spaced so you may want to eat at the counter overlooking the food expediting.

Group dinner with work colleagues - the decibel level was extremely high, so probably not the best place if you want to have a chat with friends or colleagues. But the food was good, the margaritas excellent - and I had a great time!

The food was delicious and the service was great. The restaurant is a little difficult to find, but once you do it is worth it.

Tacos are good, Calamari Skewer was good and light eats but If you are hungry and you love pork. Skip all those or one and just get the pork dinner. Probably the best pork i've had in a very long time. Could eat it everyday. Very good. They don't serve any liquor, just beer and wine. Which is unfortunate because...

We had the fish tacos, pork tacos and veggie enchiladas. All delicious. My factory would be the fish taco. The guacamole was probably the best I've ever had. And the green salsa was awesome. Service was great. Ambiance is very trendy, minimal. Oh and the margaritas are generous and tasty.

The place is very small so be prepared to wait. It is worth it. The ingredients are very fresh and everything made to order. The corn tortillas are the best. The salsa and chips are fabulous. Some of the sauces were extremely hot so have your H2o close by.

We visited during the evening and it was very busy and loud. The food was excellent and the service very good. There were quite a lot of large parties and fewer couples. Great for our teenagers but it's cool and trendy, so possibly a bit less suitable for families with young children

Yes, this was a very very good find on our trip to San Fran. . .stayed in fisherman's wharf and this restaurant was an easy walk. This place is excellent! Forget corn tortillas, order their house made flour ones. These tortillas resulted in a fight between my husband and me. He kept stealing them and I kept stabbing him with my fork to protect them. Save yourself the trouble and your marriage. Order two servings.

We went for a late brunch, and had an excellent food. The breakfast burrito was the best for me. If you get a fresh coconut to drink, they will cut it open after so you can eat the inside. This is our favorite restaurant in San Francisco, Food and the fun high energy atmosphere is really special. Menu is so different their Pork Chop is the best pork chop I had in San Francisco. Also the prices are very affordable.

Lori's Diner is a chain (for SF only, I think). It is a throwback to the 1950's diner. The decor makes you feel like you've travelled back in time. The food is good, old-fashioned diner food. Did not plan well and thought "I'll just find somewhere when I head out". This place was ok. Not sure how you make pancakes with no flavor, fruit and coffee for $20. But I was not hungry when I left but also not satisfied. It is convenient but an egg sandwich at Starbucks would have been cheaper and more satisfying.

It's a comfort food restaurant with a fifties diner look. The staff was frindly and nice and the bueger was faboulus: cook to order, perfect caramilized onions, good fries... One of the best burgers I ever had!

I always visit Lori's for breakfast whenever I'm in SF. Sitting at the counter with my eggs and coffee is a real pleasure. The food here is good, the waiting staff always friendly and there is a really good atmosphere. A real diner! Worth a visit.

The car on the street frontage was the inducement to try a real diner. Food was reasonably priced, service was prompt and the quality didn't disappoint.

Lori's Diner is another one of those neighborhood icons that everyone has to visit. The prices are fair for the location, and the food very good in general. I would recommend it for breakfast or lunch, but especially breakfast (for which they are known in particular; their omelettes are the size of one's head, and tasty to boot). Recommended!

Average service, average food. This place was really busy so I expected more. Food was really ordinary.

We had a wonderfull breakfast here. The staff was very attentetive, food was served farst and coocked to order. The Dinner was very clean, Menu had a large selection to choose from. Even the coffe was good.
Do go here and treat youself to a nice meal.

Tried this diner for the first time and found that the price of the hamburger was not in the same category as the quality of the food served. Skip it...

Wow, every dish was excellent spaghetti, ravioli, fettuccine, pizza, lasagna. Excellent service and a delicious meal.

our breakfast was fantastic.

This place has a great atmosphere, with great views. Drinks are pricey but then again it is San Francisco!

We wanted to welcome our customers and partners to San Francisco on the first night of our conference. Mission accomplished. The view was amazing. We went on Christmas day. So busy. We had to wait 30 min for our order to come. Realy understaffed.
Quite expensive.

Go for the view. It will be crowded. We found a quiet corner to chat, but didn't have any service. Had to go to the bar to get drinks, otherwise it would be a 5.

On the 39th floor of the Marriott. The view is stunning. Great selection of drinks and service. Fun place to unwind and enjoy the city.

Our first night in San Francisco was partly spent in this Bar with the most fabulous views over the city and bay
